title: iPlayCrypto
author: iPlayCrypto
content: Greetings to the communityI am happy to announce https://iplaycrypto.com/, a selection of both professional and personal experiences from the world of crypto gambling.It was created from young professionals originating from the cryptro gambling industry who decided to use this insider's knowledge in order to demomnstrate to everyone the advantages of playing with crypto. In the https://iplaycrypto.com/blog/ you will find guides to play anonymously, how to bypass geo-block or other annoying regulations. Please take a look and let us know if we missed something, feel free to make recommendations or just say hi.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: iPlayCrypto on October 29, 2022, 08:38:21 AMPlease take a look and let us know if we missed something, feel free to make recommendations or just say hi.I checked few of your blog article. Here's my thought,1. About mixing coin on article "How to make an 100% anonymous Bitcoin cashout"[1], there should be warning that many centralized/exchange doesn't accept coin from mixer/coinjoin and could lock your account[2].2. Few VPN mention on article ""Best VPN providers"[3] have questionable history. For example, ExpressVPN was bought by Kape technology with poor history[4]. [1] https://iplaycrypto.com/blog/anonymous-experience/[2] https://www.reddit.com/r/Gemini/comments/usvlny/just_received_a_disturbing_requestemail_from/[3] https://iplaycrypto.com/blog/best-vpns/[4] https://restoreprivacy.com/kape-technologies-owns-expressvpn-cyberghost-pia-zenmate-vpn-review-sites/

Please take a look and let us know if we missed something, feel free to make recommendations or just say hi.I had a quick glance at one of your "blog posts" and the following things caught my attention:Quote from: https://iplaycrypto.com/cryptowallets1) Ledger - the best hardware walletConsidering that there are a lot of ongoing issues with most of the things they've produced in the past couple of years, I don't think they deserve to have that label!Quote from: https://iplaycrypto.com/cryptowalletsBut it helps the user remain %100 is anonymous using the Ledger-created proprietary operating system.I wouldn't be so sure about that: Ledger Live Liars Data CollectionQuote from: https://iplaycrypto.com/cryptowalletsThe top eight crypto walletsYou only gave five

comments.author: logfiles
comments.created_time: October 29, 2022, 08:17:56 PMLast edit: July 19, 2023, 08:23:30 PM by logfiles
comments.body: I see you encouraging gamblers from the US to use VPN services, but here is a real problem;What if the casino requests for KYC verification after blocking funds in the account, what does the user do?Among the casinos you listed, some talk about KYC verification in their ToS, like Trust diceIt is a breach of terms to use VPN services for most casinos, too. Don't you think the readers deserve some warnings about this?

Don't you think the readers deserve some warnings about this?You are right that's why I try to mention if KYC is needed or not. There are a few casinos which officialy don't accept US players but in reality their top VIPs are from the US. So it depends. Personally I am very happy with my Ledger. Maybe you are right and using the word "best" isn't but that's pretty subjective and it's also the writing style. The best depends on one's needs.About the anonymity what's the main concern? They pass your details after the purchase?And fixed. My attention to detail is lowQuote from: ETFbitcoin on October 29, 2022, 09:42:07 AMQuote from: iPlayCrypto on October 29, 2022, 08:38:21 AMPlease take a look and let us know if we missed something, feel free to make recommendations or just say hi.I checked few of your blog article. Here's my thought,1. Thanks will include it.2. As with other articles the word best is subjective. I get your point but it still depends on a few factors. In general, I have to say I really appreciate yours and everyone else's feedback. I know there is a long way to go and its very very helpful.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: iPlayCrypto on October 31, 2022, 02:07:25 PMAbout the anonymity what's the main concern? They pass your details after the purchase?Yes, basically the things they're collecting are more than enough to build a good profile on their users, and when you combine it with their lousy track record in keeping those things safe from hackers, then it becomes worse than just sharing it with their partners!- By saying that LL users can achieve complete anonymity, you're giving your readers a false sense of security (unintentionally).

comments.author: iPlayCrypto
comments.body: Quote from: SFR10 on November 01, 2022, 06:03:08 PMQuote from: iPlayCrypto on October 31, 2022, 02:07:25 PMAbout the anonymity what's the main concern? They pass your details after the purchase?Yes, basically the things they're collecting are more than enough to build a good profile on their users, and when you combine it with their lousy track record in keeping those things safe from hackers, then it becomes worse than just sharing it with their partners!- By saying that LL users can achieve complete anonymity, you're giving your readers a false sense of security (unintentionally).Overall, I try using more neutral language but not always. The event of a hacking is mentioned at some point but I personally am very happy with it thats why I have it there. Would you recommend a more safe and private hardware wallet?

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: iPlayCrypto on October 29, 2022, 08:38:21 AMIn the https://iplaycrypto.com/blog/ you will find guides to play anonymously, how to bypass geo-block or other annoying regulations. Those annoying regulations are there for a reason. Most crypto casinos are licensed in Curacao. The common thing for almost all Curacao-licensed gambling platforms I have checked is that they don't accept players from the United States. Suggesting ways to circumvent that can get the players in a lot of problems when and if it's time to withdraw their winnings. There is one thing casinos hate more than people breaking their rules and terms and that's winners. If you won, but you broke their rules and they find out, be sure that their TOS (that you agreed to) is their protection. They will confiscate your winnings, maybe even the initial deposits. Using VPNs or socks to cheat the system works just fine if you are losing. Not so much when they decide to take a closer look at who you are. Stolen identities ad fake IDs are even worse, and I hope you aren't suggesting things like that in your articles.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: I randomly checked some blogs and fell to this one: https://iplaycrypto.com/crypto-casinos-for-whales/Though this is just a minor thing and I just noticed the wrong spelling about satoshidice which has been said in the article as sotashidice.Quote from: https://iplaycrypto.com/crypto-casinos-for-whales/Online Casinos have a rich culture within the crypto world. They've been popular since SotashiDice rolled out back in 2012 and brought a new value to what users could do with their cryptocurrencies.

comments.author: GeorgiosCoinIt
comments.body: Good luck wih your project of course. I notice it has been growing slowly but steadily. I'd suggest focusing more on Bitcoin and perhaps Ethereum or in general more established and popular tokens as altcoins often come and go and you don't know for example if XMR (which I lovo) will remain available

comments.author: Kakmakr
comments.body: I hope you will frequently update your site on the latest information, because sites freqiently make changes to their ToS and also add countries to their "restricted country" list. A lot of the newer casinos will start with a "No KYC" requirement to fund their bankroll, but as soon as they have grown into a more mature business, they do a 180 and suddenly start to ask for KYC information or the regulators take note of them and they force them to do it.
